alert.note: Alert for Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 07 at 2:16PM AKST until February 08 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, eastern gulf coast and northern inner channels, and central inner channels. This includes the cities of Gustavus, Hoonah, Elfin Cove, Pelican, Angoon, Juneau, Petersburg, Wrangell, And Kake. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Rain and snow melt runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, other low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with snow. Mariners should be aware of their vessels filling with water and sinking if moored and excess water removed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rainfall will move into the area Tuesday evening through Wednesday evening. Total rain amounts of 2.5 to 4.5 inches are expected at sea level with the period of the heaviest rain to fall Tuesday night to Wednesday afternoon. Rain on the snowpack will increase the runoff and may result in ponding of water on roads and low lying areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
